intro: Malapoenna parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved malapoenna, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
